newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam to sell 50 bln dong T-notes on Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam to sell 50 bln dong T-notes on Wednesday.

text.p: Vietnam will auction 50 billion dong ($4.52 million) in one-year Treasury notes on Wednesday, an official at the State Bank of Vietnam said on Tuesday.
At the last sale of government paper, on October 23, the central bank issued 27 billion dong worth of one-year notes to domestic institutions at an annual rate of 7.89 percent.

There have been 14 such sales so far this year, through which a total of 887 billion dong in Treasury stock has been issued. The central bank has been aiming to hold one auction every two weeks to lay the ground for a future secondary market.

Rates have fallen sharply this year, partly due to a dong surplus in the banking system. At the first sale of the year, on March 1, the state bank sold six-month bills at a rate of 15.00 percent. ($1 = 11,065 dong)
